snippet: In 2010, the prosecutor’s office in Hunterdon County, N.J., indicted the sheriff, who had ties to the then-new Christie administration; the attorney general dropped the case.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column describes incident in which indictment charging Hunterdon, NJ, county Sheriff Deborah Trout and other officials with small-town abuse of power was quashed after it was discovered that officials had ties to Gov Chris Christie; notes that lawyer Bennett Barlyn was fired for insisting that case against officials was solid; says George Washington Bridge closing scandal has given new credibility to Barlyn's claims.
lead_paragraph: In 2010, the prosecutor’s office in Hunterdon County, N.J., indicted the sheriff, who had ties to the then-new Christie administration; the attorney general dropped the case.

headline.main: Quashed Case Against Christie Ally Was Foretaste of Scandal
headline.print_headline: Quashed Case in New Jersey Was an Omen
